sourceMeaningMnemonic: You carry a <radical>cross</radical> across a <radical>rice paddy</radical> with a <radical>heart</radical> on it to return a <kanji>favor</kanji> for your friend. The heart needs to be purified so that’s why you have it on the cross and your friend lives on a rice paddy farm so that’s why you’re running through that. The favor you are paying your friend back with is getting him this heart. He needs a new one and you’re providing it.
meaningInfo: This is a pretty big favor. Imagine running through a rice paddy carrying a cross with a warm beating heart on it. Thump thump. Thump thump.
readingMnemonic: You arrive at your friend’s place and you can finally return the <kanji>favor</kanji> you owe him by presenting him with the heart. “<reading>Eh</reading> (<ja>え</ja>)? What’s this? I didn’t ask for this!” “Eh!?!?” you reply. Apparently he didn’t want a real heart, he wanted a candy one. He wanted a Valentine!
readingInfo: Imagine how dumb you feel at this miscommunication. Eh? You don’t feel dumb? Well you should!
